intro: Plenckia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited plenckia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial shrub native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
